title: After a Lag, Consumers Begin to Feel the Pinch of Tariffs
summary: There are growing signs that President Trump’s levies are filtering through to consumer prices, as companies exhaust options for keeping them stable.

title: The Stock Market Is Good, Bad and Ugly, Often in Quick Succession
summary: The market’s best days frequently occur in the midst of misery, our columnist says, so don’t bother trying to figure out where stocks are heading.

title: Lashing Out Over Russia and Jobs Data, Trump Displays His Volatile Side
summary: The president had been on something of a winning streak. But when faced with facts and foes that wouldn’t bend to his will, he responded with impatience and disproportionate intensity.

title: Until Trump Fired Her, She Was an Economist With Bipartisan Support
summary: Erika McEntarfer led the agency that produced key data on jobs and inflation. Then July’s report showed a weakening economy, and President Trump accused her of “rigging” the numbers.

title: Donor List Suggests Scale of Trump’s Pay-for-Access Operation
summary: A new disclosure shows how corporations and individuals, including many in the crypto business, wrote big checks while seeking favor from the president.

title: Mike Huckabee, Israel’s Passionate Defender as Gaza War Drives Allies Away
summary: Mr. Huckabee, a Baptist minister, is the first evangelical to serve as American ambassador to Israel. Christian conservatives and the Netanyahu government are pleased.

title: New Hostage Videos Sow Fear and Horror in Israel
summary: A “living skeleton, buried alive” in Gaza’s tunnels, was how the family of one hostage described him after seeing a video circulated by Hamas this week.

title: Texas Pushes Redistricting Into an Era of ‘Maximum Warfare’
summary: Republicans are pursuing every possible advantage, essentially trying to win elections long before people vote. In response, even some once-squeamish Democrats are talking about fighting ‘fire with fire.’

title: Texas State House Panel Advances Gerrymandered Congressional Map
summary: The full Texas House will now vote next week on a map drawn to flip five House districts to the G.O.P., but Democrats might walk out to deny Republicans a quorum.

title: Eric Holder on Why He Reversed Course on Gerrymandering
summary: Mr. Holder, the attorney general in the Obama administration, has long fought to end gerrymandered legislative maps. But a Republican effort in Texas threatens democracy, he said in an interview.

title: How the New Texas Map Changes the Outlook for Control of the House
summary: Democrats’ chances would be hurt if the map were approved, but they would still be favored.

title: A Day at Two San Francisco Malls, One That Died and One That Thrived
summary: The downtown mall was long considered a thriving retail anchor, while the suburban-style one was an afterthought. They had a surprising role reversal.

title: Ken Marino and David Wain Are Rocking Out With Their Dad Jam Band
summary: The members of Middle Aged Dad Jam Band are known for making people laugh. But they take their music seriously.

title: No Pets Left Behind: How a Dog’s Hurricane Rescue Changed Florida Law
summary: A state trooper went to the aid of a bull terrier who had been abandoned as Hurricane Milton approached. Now the dog, named Trooper, is thriving, and his story inspired stricter animal protections.

title: With Festivities and Papal Prayer, the Vatican Aims to Attract the Young
summary: At a gathering that has been called the “Catholic Woodstock,” the church has embraced influencers on social media as a way to engage the youth.

title: An American Team Went to Combat Haiti’s Gangs, Then Lost Two of Its Own
summary: A Haitian American Navy veteran and his police officer cousin who were working in Haiti with Studebaker, an American military contractor, are missing and presumed dead.

title: Attention, Men: Books Are Sexy!
summary: Nobody likes a dumb guy.

title: Gwyneth Paltrow Sells Astronomer Like She Sells Goop
summary: Why do we buy whatever it is that she is selling?

title: Search in Montana Continues for Suspect in Fatal Anaconda Bar Shooting
summary: Officials urged residents to go about their weekend as the authorities searched the foothills for the veteran suspected of killing four people in the town of Anaconda.

title: The Law in West Texas Breaks the Law to Protest Weed’s Prohibition
summary: Sarah Stogner, a Republican district attorney in Texas oil country, recorded herself smoking a joint that she bought legally in New Mexico.

title: Production Manager Is Killed in Accident at Jacob’s Pillow, Authorities Say
summary: Jacob’s Pillow canceled weekend programming as staff members grieved the death of Kat Sirico, who was moving staging platforms that toppled, the authorities said.

title: David Rendall, Tenor Who Suffered 2 Operatic Mishaps, Dies at 76
summary: He appeared regularly at the Metropolitan Opera and sang in major European opera houses, but a stage accident in 2005 nearly ended his career.
